consignee.description: The receiver or buyer of the goods.

grossWeight.description: The total gross weight of all the goods. Usually mentioned as G.W or GW or Gross Weight, etc..

incoterm.description: An Incoterm is a 3 letter standardized trade term defining the responsibilities of buyers and sellers in international shipping and logistics. For example, FOB, CFR, DAP, CIF, etc...

invoiceDate.description: A date that the invoice was created or issued.

invoiceNumber.description: The invoice number of the commercial invoice document.

measurement.description: The volume of the goods. Usually, it is measured in "Cubic Meter (cbm)" or dimensions. But volume in "cbm" is preferred.

netWeight.description: The total net weight of all the goods. Usually, mentioned as N.W or NW or Net Weight, etc..

shipper.description: The seller or shipper of the goods.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of all the goods mentioned in the invoice.

containerNumber.description: Container Number consists of 4 capital letters followed by 7 digits. Example: TEMU7972458. Usually mentioned as Container Number, CONTAINER NO. Containers, or Container / Truck No

currency.description: The currency of the Amount. Usually mentioned in USD, EURO, CNY, $, or any other currency units and symbols.

grossWeight.description: The gross weight of an individual product/goods. Usually, mentioned as G.W or GW or Gross Weight, etc..

hsCode.description: The harmonized system code of a goods.

materialNumber.description: Material number of the product or goods.

netWeight.description: The net weight of an individual product/goods. Usually, mentioned as N.W or NW or Net Weight, etc..

packagingQuantity.description: The quantity of the goods. Usually, the quantity is in pallets, PLT, cartons, CTNS, pieces, PCS, packages, boxes, etc. Please prioritize the packaging types based on their size, as follows: Pallets (PLT) >> Cartons (CTNS) >> Pieces (PCS). Extract the Larger packaging types that will have a lower count.

packageType.description: The packaging type is the unit of packagingQuantity. Example; pallets, PLT, cartons, CTNS, pieces, PCS, packages, etc. Sometimes, the packaging type is available in the column name of the packagingQuantity.
